title: The Art World Came to Kosovo. What Happens When It Leaves?
description: In a young country with little infrastructure for the arts, the roving art biennial Manifesta has brought an opportunity to develop international connections and build a profile.
dc:creator: Alex Marshall
media:credit: Armend Nimani for The New York Times
media:description: Visitors looking at an installation by Mette Sterre, on display at the Grand Hotel in Pristina, Kosovo, as part of the 14th edition of Manifesta.
